last_episode_to_air.name: End of an Era
last_episode_to_air.overview: With the Nokkers defeated, the people of Renril rejoice, and Fushi and his friends discuss their hopes for the future.

name: To Your Eternity
overview: In the beginning, an "orb" is cast unto Earth. "It" can do two things: change into the form of the thing that stimulates "it"; and come back to life after death. "It" morphs from orb to rock, then to wolf, and finally to boy, but roams about like a newborn who knows nothing. As a boy, "it" becomes Fushi. Through encounters with human kindness, Fushi not only gains survival skills, but grows as a "person". But his journey is darkened by the inexplicable and destructive enemy Nokker, as well as cruel partings with the people he loves.

seasons.name: Season 1
seasons.overview:
An Orb, known only as It, is cast to Earth to be observed from afar. Capable of changing forms from beings whose reflections It captures, It first becomes a rock and then, due to the rising temperature, moss.

It does not move until one snowy day, a wolf at death's door barely crosses by. When It takes the animal's form, It attains awareness of its consciousness and starts to wander with an unclear destination in mind. Soon, It comes across the wolf's master—a young boy waiting for his tribe to return from a paradise abundant with fish and fruit in the south. Although the boy is lonely, he still hopes those whom he holds dear in his memories have not forgotten him and that he will reunite with them one day.

The boy wants to explore new surroundings and decides to abandon his home with It to find the paradise using the traces his tribe left behind. However, with a heavily injured body and no sight of his elder comrades, what will become of the boy?

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview:
After seeing enough death and tragedy, the immortal Fushi secludes himself on an island, defending himself from enemy Nokkers. However, instead of attacking Fushi in isolation, Nokkers begin targeting the settlements outside of his reach in hopes of luring him out. Soon, a group known as the Guardians—led by Hisame, the descendant of the deceased warrior Hayase—finds Fushi.

Inspired by how Fushi protected Janada Island from the Nokkers years ago, the Guardians have grown a considerable following and are recognized throughout the world. Initially reluctant, Fushi allows the Guardians to accompany him to the site of the Nokkers' recent attack. In their village, Fushi meets a few valuable allies, both new and old. But as the conflict with the Nokkers only leads to more loss, Fushi must find the inner strength to face his inevitable sorrow.

episodes.name: The Last One
episodes.overview: An orb is tossed upon the earth. It transforms to match its surrounding environment: first a rock, then moss, then a dying wolf. The wolf returns to its last remaining family, a boy living alone in a small home in the snow.

episodes.name: A Rambunctious Girl
episodes.overview: The orb, having morphed into a boy, finds its way to Ninanna, where he is attacked. He is discovered by a girl, March, who may not achieve her goal of becoming a grown-up.

episodes.name: A Small Evolution
episodes.overview: March is escorted to the altar to be sacrificed to Oniguma. Along the way, she tends to Fushi, who, despite having the body of a young man, doesn’t seem to have the mind of one.

episodes.name: A Large Vessel
episodes.overview: Hayase, interested in Fushi’s inability to die, brings him along with March, Parona and Pioran to the nation of Yanome. They are shown around town and treated well, but things are not as they seem.

episodes.name: Those Who Follow
episodes.overview: Fushi, March and Parona continue their escape from Yanome and back to Ninanna. Hayase chases after them, especially in order to capture Fushi.

episodes.name: Our Goals
episodes.overview: Having gained a semblance of humanity, Fushi sets off on his own. He encounters Pioran again, who teachers him words and writing, helping him live as a human being.

episodes.name: The Boy Who Wants to Change
episodes.overview: Fushi and Pioran arrive at Takunaha, where they meet Booze Man and a boy named Gugu. Gugu, who had been living with Booze Man for several months following an accident, warms up to Fushi.

episodes.name: Monster Brothers
episodes.overview: Fushi explains to Gugu how his form as the wolf, Joaan, and March, came to be. Gugu explains death to Fushi. Together, they come to understand the meaning of family.

episodes.name: Deep Memories
episodes.overview: Fushi tells Gugu about the wolf, Joaan, and the boy he took on the form of. Gugu explains death to Fushi, recalling his own past, working for a wealthy family with his brother.

episodes.name: New Family
episodes.overview: Fushi and Gugu fight against the Nokkers that they encountered in the forest. Though the situation is grim, Gugu has a trick up his sleeve.

episodes.name: Gift From the Past
episodes.overview: Four years after their encounter with the Nokkers, Fushi and Gugu have grown into fine young men. They’re invited to Rean’s birthday party after a brief reunion with Gugu’s brother.

episodes.name: Awakening
episodes.overview: Just as Gugu and Rean come to understand each other, the Nokkers emerge, causing panic in the party hall. Fushi and Gugu are forced to fight.

episodes.name: Aspiring to Go Higher
episodes.overview: Fushi leaves Booze Man’s home and sets out to wander aimlessly around Takunaha. He has many questions for the Observer, but can’t seem to get any straight answers.

episodes.name: Jananda, Island of Freedom
episodes.overview: Fushi and Pioran are separated on the prison island of Jananda. He enters a tournament where, if he survives until the end, he will be granted the right to do anything he wants – including leaving the island with Pioran.

episodes.name: A Girl Named Tonari
episodes.overview: Fushi transforms into Parona of Ninannah in the middle of the tournament. He is shocked when he realizes what this implies. Meanwhile, Tonari, desperate to have Fushi join her and her friends, offers to help rescue Pioran.

episodes.name: The Children's Dreams
episodes.overview: Fushi just barely manages to take down the Nokkers. He opens up to the others, and they discuss their dreams and pasts.

episodes.name: The Defeated
episodes.overview: Having defeated Fushi, Hayase makes a surprising proposal to the people of the island of Jananda.

episodes.name: To Continue On
episodes.overview: Tonari returns to Jananda to rescue Fushi. Before setting out again, they stay the night in a cave, and Tonari shares her past.

episodes.name: Wandering Rage
episodes.overview: Fushi, Tonari and their friends fight the Nokkers, who have taken over corpses.

episodes.name: Echoes
episodes.overview: Fushi parts ways with Tonari and heads to the port where Pioran is waiting for him. He worries that he may attract the Nokkers again and endanger her.

1.name: Season 1
1.overview:
An Orb, known only as It, is cast to Earth to be observed from afar. Capable of changing forms from beings whose reflections It captures, It first becomes a rock and then, due to the rising temperature, moss.

It does not move until one snowy day, a wolf at death's door barely crosses by. When It takes the animal's form, It attains awareness of its consciousness and starts to wander with an unclear destination in mind. Soon, It comes across the wolf's master—a young boy waiting for his tribe to return from a paradise abundant with fish and fruit in the south. Although the boy is lonely, he still hopes those whom he holds dear in his memories have not forgotten him and that he will reunite with them one day.

The boy wants to explore new surroundings and decides to abandon his home with It to find the paradise using the traces his tribe left behind. However, with a heavily injured body and no sight of his elder comrades, what will become of the boy?

episodes.name: Infatuation Reborn
episodes.overview: Fushi, having spent several decades alone on an island, learns that a village was attacked by the Nokkers.

episodes.name: Beating Will
episodes.overview: Things do not go well when Tonari tries to remove the Nokker from Hisame's arm.

episodes.name: The Awaited
episodes.overview: Kahaku, the sixth of Hayase's descendants, introduces himself to Fushi. Much time has passed, and the Guardians have expanded their influence.

episodes.name: The Young Man Who Can See
episodes.overview: Fushi must stay on the move in order to keep the Nokkers from attacking, so Prince Bon accompanies him out of the castle town.

episodes.name: The Holy Man's Voyage
episodes.overview: Fushi, along with Kahaku, Bon and Bon's army, travel through several towns, spreading word of the Nokkers along the way.

episodes.name: Heretics Betrayed
episodes.overview: Kahaku asks Fushi to marry him. He seems confident that they can overcome the complications of Fushi being a shape-shifting immortal, but Fushi isn’t. Cylira returns.

episodes.name: Crime and Forgiveness
episodes.overview: Fushi attempts to escape from his iron cell, while Bon and Todo await their trial in their own cells.

episodes.name: Beyond Dreams
episodes.overview: The Kingdom of Ularis, along with Fushi, Todo, Bon's family, and Baron Spring Roll, prepare for life without Bon.

episodes.name: Expanding Consciousness
episodes.overview: As warned by Kahaku’s arm, the Nokkers attack the head church of the Church of Bennett, causing terrible devastation.

episodes.name: Resonance
episodes.overview: Fushi trains his senses in preparation for the Nokkers’ attack on Renril. He discovers a strange girl in a circus tent.

episodes.name: The Value of Flesh
episodes.overview: Having finished training on the derelict ship, Fushi travels to Renril, where the Nokkers are threatening to attack.

episodes.name: Secret Behind the Veil
episodes.overview: Fushi and his allies work to win over the trust of the people of Renril in preparation for the Nokkers’ attack.

episodes.name: The Wise Man's Identity
episodes.overview: The team works to prevent the Nokkers from making use of the waterways and sewers. Fushi works non-stop rebuilding all the homes, and the exhaustion begins to show.

episodes.name: Morning of Rebirth
episodes.overview: The city of Renril bands together around Fushi in preparation for the Nokkers’ attack. The princess introduces him to her father, King Boldron of Sonia.

episodes.name: The Self, Worn Down
episodes.overview: Fushi fends off the Nokkers miles away from Renril, but the Nokkers had already devised a more cunning plan.

episodes.name: Three Eternal Warriors
episodes.overview: The death of his three friends turns Fushi mad, and he begins defeating the Nokkers at a furious pace. But as it turns out, he may not be the only immortal.

episodes.name: What You Want to Protect
episodes.overview: Amidst the brutal battle against the Nokkers, Bon and Kahaku both share a desire to protect Fushi’s humanity. How they go about it, however, puts them at odds.

episodes.name: Death of the Deathless
episodes.overview: March begins her desperate search for Fushi, whose absence has led to the city being overrun by the Nokkers.

episodes.name: And Then, Dawn
episodes.overview: In the beginning, it was an orb. And Fushi was an orb once again. But though there was no certainty, there was hope.

episodes.name: End of an Era
episodes.overview: With the Nokkers defeated, the people of Renril rejoice, and Fushi and his friends discuss their hopes for the future.

2.overview:

However, instead of attacking Fushi in isolation, Nokkers begin targeting the settlements outside of his reach in hopes of luring him out. Soon, a group known as the Guardians—led by Hisame, the descendant of the deceased warrior Hayase—finds Fushi.

Inspired by how Fushi protected Janada Island from the Nokkers years ago, the Guardians have grown a considerable following and are recognized throughout the world. Initially reluctant, Fushi allows the Guardians to accompany him to the site of the Nokkers' recent attack. In their village, Fushi meets a few valuable allies, both new and old. But as the conflict with the Nokkers only leads to more loss, Fushi must find the inner strength to face his inevitable sorrow.
